title: Blank Blocks and Common Errors
description:
The program below was writen by another programmer who made an error when they used a blank block and typed the output command. Run the program. Then read the error in the output window. Using the error message fix the error and run the program again to see if it works.

If you get stuck, select the check button to learn about the common error.
hint:
Did you notice that the o in output was uppercase in the code? This is a very common error that programmers run into. When they type output commands or any other commands, they can make mistakes with the case of the names because they are case-sensitive. You can avoid these types of errors by using the block instead of typing it out. As you become a better programmer you will need to be able to type your code and identify these common errors.

You can fix this error by deleting the uppercase O and replacing it with a lowercase o. The right command would be output "Hello World!".
